sect1.title: Packet Loss
sect1.para: Packet loss occurs when one or more packets of data traveling across a network fails to reach their destination. Packet loss has arguably the greatest impact on the quality of a Scenic session. When a packet is lost, this means that the recepient will not have this data. The effect is easily perceptible.
Effects of packet loss on audio signal. Distortions in the sound: Metallic sound effect, tics and pops. Loss of part of the audio signal, not unlike losing your signal while using a cell phone.
Effects of packet loss on video signal include dropped frames, missing pixels and other artifacts.
